subject: Advanced Statistical Physics
title: Advanced Statistical Physics (TUM, Module NAT3002)
description: Phase transitions and critical phenomena, Landau–Ginzburg theory and fluctuations, renormalization group (fundamentals and applications), irreversible processes and nonequilibrium phenomena, percolation theory. Workload 300 h (90 h contact), 10 ECTS, offered in winter term. Version 2025w responsible: Alim, Karen. Language: DE/EN.

goals.title: Advanced Statistical Physics – Module Overview
goals.description: Learner can analyze critical phenomena, apply Landau–Ginzburg and renormalization-group methods, and discuss nonequilibrium processes and percolation.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can analyze critical phenomena, apply Landau–Ginzburg and renormalization-group methods, and discuss nonequilibrium processes and percolation.

goals.title: Critical Phenomena & Exponents
goals.description: Learner can explain phase transitions and critical phenomena and analyze systems using critical exponents.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can explain phase transitions and critical phenomena and analyze systems using critical exponents.

goals.title: Landau–Ginzburg & Fluctuations
goals.description: Learner can explain Landau–Ginzburg theory, incorporate fluctuations, and connect to critical behavior.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can explain Landau–Ginzburg theory, incorporate fluctuations, and connect to critical behavior.

goals.title: Renormalization Group
goals.description: Learner understands RG basics, can apply RG to given systems, and interpret flow, fixed points, and scaling.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner understands RG basics, can apply RG to given systems, and interpret flow, fixed points, and scaling.

goals.title: Nonequilibrium & Irreversible Processes
goals.description: Learner can outline approaches to nonequilibrium physics, compare irreversible processes, and discuss nonequilibrium universality.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can outline approaches to nonequilibrium physics, compare irreversible processes, and discuss nonequilibrium universality.

goals.title: Percolation & Universality
goals.description: Learner can describe percolation theory, relate it to critical phenomena, and understand nonequilibrium universality classes.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can describe percolation theory, relate it to critical phenomena, and understand nonequilibrium universality classes.

descriptionEn: Phase transitions and critical phenomena, Landau–Ginzburg theory and fluctuations, renormalization group (fundamentals and applications), irreversible processes and nonequilibrium phenomena, percolation theory. Workload 300 h (90 h contact), 10 ECTS, offered in winter term. Version 2025w responsible: Alim, Karen. Language: DE/EN.
